meanings.definition: Lacking in manners or refinement; uncivilized.
meanings.sent1: The inurbane man spoke loudly in the quiet library.
meanings.sent2: Her inurbane behavior at the dinner party shocked everyone.
meanings.sent3: The inurbane puppy jumped on the table during dinner.
meanings.sent4: The inurbane storm tore through the peaceful town.
meanings.sent5: The inurbane guest belched loudly at the formal event.

meanings.definition: Not suave or sophisticated; lacking in social graces.
meanings.sent1: His inurbane jokes made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: She felt out of place in the inurbane nightclub.
meanings.sent3: The inurbane dancer tripped over his own feet on stage.
meanings.sent4: The inurbane painting clashed with the elegant decor.
meanings.sent5: The inurbane handshake was awkward and clumsy.

meanings.definition: Not polished or elegant in style or manner.
meanings.sent1: The inurbane furniture in the waiting room was uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: His inurbane outfit was a mismatch of colors and patterns.
meanings.sent3: The inurbane speech was filled with stumbles and pauses.
meanings.sent4: The inurbane garden was overgrown and messy.
meanings.sent5: The inurbane music blared from the old, crackling speakers.
